Ok. An architect. A pro. Let’s assume price is no object, not if it helps your productivity. If you REALLY want an all-in-one, then the 2 things making the most noise right now are the Surface Studio and the new iMac. If you’re an Apple lover and think the pen/touchscreen is a useless gimmick because Apple hasn’t done one, buy the iMac. If you are a PC user and think the touchscreen is a gimmick, and you can live without the AIO form… buy a top-end gaming tower. It will run all your software with power to spare. You don’t really need the GPU, but it won’t hurt you - and you never know, you might play a game now and then. If you love the touch-screen, buy a good gaming tower, and add a Wacom Pen Display The Surface Studio? I love the concept. It’s an undeniably sexy piece of engineering, and a huge step forward for MS… but it’s more than a little underpowered for smooth use of Autocad, 3ds max, photoshop….etc. If you really want one, (they really ARE cool) I’d strongly suggest waiting for the 2nd gen.
